text.author: LyKaxandra Caimoy, jarginger inolikeylastnames, Nadia and others (see URL)
text.title: How to Play Muggle Quidditch
text.summary1: (human1) This guide suggests ways to play Harry Potter's game of Quidditch in real life (Muggle Quidditch), by optionally riding on brooms, using three deflated dodge balls as bludgers for beaters to bat at players, a volleyball as a quaffle for chasers to throw into goal hoops, and a coin, ball or a running person as the snitch, which possibly blindfolded seekers must find.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) This guide explains how to play Muggle Quidditch, a real-world adaptation of the magical sport from Harry Potter, involving players on brooms using various balls to score points, with chasers scoring goals, beaters throwing bludgers, keepers defending hoops, and seekers pursuing a human “snitch” for a modified 30-point reward.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) This guide explains that Muggle Quidditch, adapted from the Harry Potter series, is gaining global popularity. It follows International Quidditch Association rules, with players on brooms and roles such as chasers, beaters, keepers, and seekers. The objective is to score points with a quaffle, bludgers, and catch the snitch to end the game.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to play Muggle Quidditch, a non-magical version of the sport from the Harry Potter series, with rules and variations for teams and players.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Muggle Quidditch is a non-magical adaptation of the Harry Potter sport played with various objects and rules, often involving 15 players divided into two teams competing to score goals and capture the snitch.
